name: Lab Technician - Cannabis Tissue Culture
description:
Dark Heart Nursery, the leader in cannabis clone production in California, is looking for a Lab Technician to join our team in our Lab in Davis, CA.

This is a Full Time Position.

POSITION SUMMARY

Under the direction of the Lab Manager and in alignment with the Company Core Values, the Lab Technician assists in all day to day lab activities in a tissue culture production environment, including, but not limited to, processing plant materials, preparing media, employing aseptic technique, capturing data, sanitizing tools and equipment, and maintaining lab cleanliness.

Essential Duties and Responsibilities:
Follow standard operating procedures at all times in a safe and compliant manner.

Subculture plants and tissues using aseptic technique.

Prepare media suitable for plants or tissues to be cultured.

Prepare plants or tissues for initiation into culture.

Collect and process tissues for diagnostic testing.

Record data for inventory management, KPI's, and R&D.

Set up and operate equipment, including autoclave, microscope, pumps, and centrifuges.

Maintain clean lab area, glassware, and equipment.

Collaborate with and provide support to lab staff.

Contribute to process improvement and R&D efforts.

Promptly report breaches in compliance, safety, and sanitation to management.

Other duties may be assigned as required.

QUALIFICATIONS

To perform this job successfully, an individual must be able to perform each essential duty satisfactorily (with or without accommodations). The requirements listed below are representative of the knowledge, skill, and ability required.

Education and Experience:
HS diploma or equivalent required, Bachelor’s degree in a relevant scientific discipline preferred

6+ months of applicable laboratory and/or plant propagation experience preferred

Previous micropropagation and/or aseptic technique experience strongly preferred

Competencies:
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills

Ability to work independently and in collaboration with teams

Proven ability to perform a variety of tasks under time constraints and strict deadlines

Demonstrated efficiency, productivity, attention to detail, accuracy, and organization

Excellent written and verbal communication skills

Ability to accurately enter data in a spreadsheet or form

PHYSICAL DEMANDS:
Remaining in a seated or standing position for extended periods of time

Performing delicate, repetitive tasks with hands, fingers, and wrists

Exercising a consistently high degree of accuracy when using fine motor skills

Reach overhead and/or use step stool

Able to lift/carry up to 50 pounds

Must wear PPE, including gloves, mask/respirator, eye protection, and lab coat

Good eyesight (may be corrected)

Expressing or exchanging ideas by means of the spoken word

WORK ENVIRONMENT:
Climate controlled laboratory conditions

Confined space and secured area

Strong odors from machinery, culture media, plant matter, alcohol, bleach, and other chemicals

Loud noises from machinery

Exposure to hazardous chemicals

Normal hours of operation Monday through Friday, 8:00 a.m. – 4:30 p.m. (may be subject to change depending on operational needs)

EEOC STATEMENT:
Dark Heart Nursery, Inc. provides equal employment opportunities (EEO) to all employees and applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, national origin, age, disability, genetic information, marital status, amnesty, or status as a covered veteran in accordance with applicable federal, state and local laws. Dark Heart Nursery complies with applicable state and local laws governing nondiscrimination in employment in every location in which the company has facilities. This policy applies to all terms and conditions of employment, including, but not limited to, hiring, placement, promotion, termination, layoff, recall, transfer, leaves of absence, compensation, and training.

name: CDP (Cannabis Derived Product) Manager
description:
Exempt /Full-time (40 weekly hours)

Reports To: VP Operations

Collaborates With: All Operations Teams, Cultivation/Harvest, Marketing, Product Manager and Dispensary Operations

Job Summary:
Oversee the manufacturing, labeling and inventory control of cannabis derived products for distribution through dispensaries. This position is responsible for effectively managing a small team and manufacturing schedule for edibles, cartridges and topicals. This department will also support cannabis extraction process and oil/distillate production. This position is expected to execute research and development of new products, flavors and configurations. The CDP Manager is expected to audit the quality of products being manufactured and developed.

This role must be engaged in increasing efficiency through implementation of automation, leveraging best practices and ensuring product availability for all retail locations. This position is expected to implement and audit inventory control measures to reduce risk and product loss.

This role commits to spend the first 6 months training on all product manufacturing, extraction, distillation and development processes.

Responsibilities/Essential Functions:
Build, train and maintain a high-performing, collaborative and adaptable team.
Supervise staff and processes to ensure high-quality, consistent, reliable, compliant and safe product manufacturing.
Develop and execute the manufacturing schedule to ensure product availability.
Track and manage key performance metrics including productivity, margins, and quality.
Partner with Marketing to support specials and promotions.
Innovate and create new CDP products and processes that align with the Verdes brand.
Partner with Process Engineer to ensure equipment is properly used and maintained.
Maintain updated processes, procedures, and batch record to support GMP-like manufacturing.
Ensure raw materials and supplies are maintained to support consistent manufacturing schedules.
Manage LeafLogix for inventory, recipes, labels, transfers, manifests and seed-to-sale controls.
Maintain a safe and clean work environment.
Edibles: Oversee the preparation of a variety of products according to established recipes. Keep a consistent and accurate stock of ingredients and supplies. Complete production sheets and other records as required. Package and label finished baked goods. Observe necessary commercial kitchen hygiene. Clean and maintain work areas, utensils and equipment.
Lab: Observe Lab Standard Procedures.?Extract cannabis oil to be used for edible production?and maintain quality and yields for oil and distillate production.?Produce a variety of lab products (tinctures, concentrates, beverages, etc). Prepare and submit samples for testing.?Conform to all standard safety requirements. Maintain lab in a safe and clean manner.?Perform routine housekeeping responsibilities (sweep, mop, clean glassware and equipment, surface cleaning). Order?and procure?supplies unique to this operation.?
Production: Oversee preparation and manifesting of product orders. Ensure product labels and barcodes are printed properly and applied to products manually or using automated equipment. Assist all departments with product packaging and labeling. Maintain inventory to ensure product availability.
Other duties as assigned, including delivery of product to manufacturing and/or retail locations.

Required Skills and Qualifications:
Bachelor’s degree and experience managing a team
Experience working in highly regulated industries. Understanding of regulations and compliance in the cannabis industry.
Acquire and maintain certification in Food Service Safety and Sanitation
Strong attention to detail and quality.
Able to perform basic math and algebraic equations.
Excellent problem-solving, organizational, analytical and critical thinking skills. Ability to prioritize work and make complex decisions.
Ability to listen, develop strategy and tactics, communicate and direct your team.
Able to use a computer to track inventory, print labels and UPC codes/tags.
Able to perform basic tasks in Outlook, Teams, Word and Excel.

Preferred Qualifications:
Manufacturing experience, specifically experience with GMP, GDP or GLP
Continuous improvement certification (Lean, Six Sigma, Agile, Design Thinking, etc.)
Cooking and baking experience
Experience or awareness with laboratory equipment and processes

General Housekeeping:
Perform routine housekeeping activities to maintain a safe workspace

Computer Preferred Qualifications:
Robust Excel knowledge and experience

Physical and Emotional Requirements:
Must be able to stand for long periods of time, 8 – 10 hours multiple days in a row
Must be able to lift at least 50 lbs.
Ability to work in a confined area.
Must be able to bend/stoop/climb/reach
Must be able to present complex information to groups of people
Must be able to be physically present in work location
Ability to handle high stress situations, ambiguity and changing priorities
Must be able to tolerate a reasonable amount of work stress

Compensation/Hours:
Compensation - DOE; 40 hours/wk., Required Mon – Fri, some weekends and Holidays, 8:00am to 5:00pm

It is the policy of The Verdes Foundation to provide equal employment (EEO) to all persons regardless of age, color, national origin, citizenship status, physical or mental disability, race, religion, creed, gender, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, and/or expression, genetic information, marital status, status with regard to public assistance, veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by federal, state or local law. In addition, The Verdes Foundation, will provide reasonable accommodations for qualified individuals with disabilities.

name: Analytical Chemist - Metals
description:
ABOUT YOU

Are you passionate and ready to join an inclusive work environment, committed to leading new ideas and pathways, and to delivering value? If the answer is, “Yes!” then we have an exciting career opportunity for you. Who are we? We are Montrose, a leading environmental services company with 1,600 employees across 70 locations worldwide, focused on supporting clients as they deal with the environmental challenges of today, and prepare for what’s coming tomorrow.

WHAT WE CAN OFFER YOU

Our Mission is: To help protect the air we breathe, the water we drink, and the soil that feeds us, and is supported by our Principles: We Value Our People, We Value Our Community, We Value Our Clients, We Value Our Shareholders. We care for the well-being of our people and offer:

Competitive compensation packages
Industry leading benefits packages including company paid life and disability insurance
Paid parental leave benefits
Progressive vacation policies and company holidays including floating holidays to meet the diverse needs of our people.
401(k) plan offered
A financial assistance program to help support peers in need
An educational reimbursement program
Access to best rates in the industry to bring your student loan debt down to size

A DAY IN THE LIFE

Enthalpy Analytical, is part of the larger organization, Montrose Environmental Group, is comprised of over 9 laboratories servicing air, water, soil, tobacco, cannabis, and toxicology testing. Regulations drive the need for our services, but our unique capabilities allow us to add value to clients beyond environmental compliance.

Our Orange, CA facility is currently seeking a Full-Time Analyst to join our Metals Department.

As a key member of the laboratory team, this role will be responsible for a full range of activities including:

Daily monitoring of sample scheduling to ensure that samples are analyzed within EPA's and methods’ holding time
Schedule workload in order to report data within clients expected due dates
Routine sample preparation and analysis according to Standard Methods 846 and EPA methods
Performs analyst's review of data and QC
Reviews of QA/QC criteria for batch acceptance
Adheres to Standard Operating Procedures and follow safe work practices
Participates in instruments' preventative maintenance and trouble shooting
Participates in focus teams to improve efficiency
Be flexible in work schedule including overtime when needed
React to change productively and handle other essential tasks as assigned
Performing other duties and responsibilities as prescribed by the Company
Compliance with Enthalpy's Quality Assurance Program and other policies

NECESSARY QUALIFICATIONS

To perform this job successfully, individuals must be able to perform each duty and responsibility satisfactorily. The requirements listed below are representative of the knowledge, skill, and/or ability required. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the duties and responsibilities.

Bachelor's degree in Chemistry, Biology, Environmental Science, or related field
Minimum 2-4 years of lab experience preferred
Knowledge of analytical method, analytical instruments, general lab practices and lab safety
Experience in ICP, ICPMS or IC is a plus

Preferred Skills

Knowledge of analytical method, analytical instruments, general lab practices and lab safety
Must be flexible in work schedule (including Saturday) and able to work overtime
Well organized and have an attention to detail
Able to multi-task
Ability to work independently and make sound decisions

The above statements are intended to describe the general nature of work being performed by people assigned to this classification. They are not to be construed as an exhaustive list of all responsibilities, duties and skills required of employees so classified.

MAKE THE MOVE

From comprehensive air measurement and laboratory services to regulatory compliance, emergency response, permitting, engineering, and remediation, Montrose delivers innovative and practical design, engineering and operational solutions that keep its clients on top of their immediate needs – and well ahead of the strategic curve. We are a fast-paced and dynamic team. At Montrose, you are your own boss, but you will get tons of guidance and plenty of support from talented, super-smart colleagues. Therefore, if freedom, autonomy, head-scratching professional challenges attract you, we’d love to speak with you.

Want to know more about us? Visit montrose-env.com and have fun!

Montrose is an Equal Opportunity Employer. Montrose is committed to providing access and reasonable accommodation in its employment for individuals with disabilities.

name: LC/MS Chemist - Cannabis Testing
description:
Demeter of Oklahoma / Metis QA Lab is a medical marijuana testing lab located in North Oklahoma City. We are a premier state-of-the-art laboratory with extensive expertise in cannabis testing and analysis. We utilize standardized scientific instrumentation for all cannabis testing and screening procedures including cannabinoid potency, residual solvents, pesticides, mycotoxins, microbial, and heavy metal.

Responsibilities:
The LC/MS Chemist will be responsible for processing and analyzing medical marijuana samples to provide information on pesticides, mycotoxins and other compounds present using Shimadzu 8050 and SciEx 4500 LC-MS/MS.

Essential Job Duties Include:
Prepare and analyze samples from various cultivators, processors, and dispensaries to meet the rules and regulations governing medical marijuana testing in the State of Oklahoma.
Responsible for operating, troubleshooting both Shimadzu 8050 and SciEx 4500 LC-MS/MS.
Prepare chemical solutions for use in processing samples, following standardized formulas or experimental procedures.
Documents results of tests and analyses in an organized and timely manner.
Interpret data and communicate specimen results with cultivators, processors, dispensaries, and laboratory staff with complete confidentiality.
Demonstrates basic knowledge of laboratory quality control and assurance procedures in compliance with ISO regulations.
Responsible for testing, calibrating, and performing quality control tests on lab equipment.
Promotes a positive and safe work environment through understanding of safety (OSHA) regulations, practices, and procedures, including but not limited to biological and chemical hazards.
Follows all company policies and procedures to ensure product integrity and quality control.
Works with laboratory information management system (LIMS).
Reports directly to the laboratory manager.
Willing to meet on-call obligations as needed.

Knowledge, Skills and Abilities:
B.S. in technical science, MS preferred.
Chemistry lab experience using a variety of analytical techniques and instrumentation.
Excellent listening and communication skills, self-motivated with strong organizational and teamwork skills; and strong written and verbal communication skills.
Must be customer service oriented.
LC-MS experience required, particularly operating Shimadzu and Sciex platforms.

Special Requirements:
Candidate must retain confidentiality and all reasonable precautions to keep clients’ data and other information confidential.
Valid Driver’s License
Must be able to legally work in the United States.

Physical Requirements:
Able to lift/carry up to 25 pounds.
Ability to bend at the waist, squat.
Ability to work with hands, see and hear.

Conditions of Employment:
Contingent upon a favorable background check.
Contingent on passing a pre-employment drug screening.
Must maintain a valid driver’s license.

The above primary duties, responsibilities, and position requirements are not all inclusive.

name: Dispensary Inventory Supervisor
description:
Reports to:Retail Store Manager

Department:Retail

Required Permits/Licensing/Registration: Marijuana Establishment Agent Card

FLSA Status:Exempt

Supervisory Responsibilities:
Dispensary Inventory Lead

Dispensary Hosts

Overview:
Following policies set forth by the Company in concert with the Retail Manager and Sales, provide support in the general operation of the company through the organization and management of Dispensary inventory to maximize operational efficiency.

Essential Functions:
Support the operations of the Retail Department by accurate and efficient management of all merchandise and cannabis product inventories.

Fulfill daily obligations to the satisfaction of supervisory staff

Thorough communication of any obstacle which limits their capability to see individual duties through to completion

Relay to superiors any conditions observed that may affect the successful completion of that day’s work.

Complete or oversee everyday inventory control responsibilities including but not limited to;

Assignment, generation, and application of required packaging tags

Incoming internal and external product transfers (acceptance upon intake)

Transfer manifest acceptance (upon verification of physical inventory received)

Verification of the receipt of all required transfer specific supporting documentation for all products received including:

Independent Testing Laboratory Certificates of Analysis

Soil Amendments/Disclosures

Addition of saleable products to POS inventory

Performance of periodic, monthly, and quarterly inventory reconciliations

All matters related to compliance of State and Federal regulations.

Utilizes internal and Department of Taxation mandated databases to ensure accuracy of incoming shipments and corresponding manifests/invoices

Fulfill assigned responsibilities in line with procedures set forth by all department Standard Operating Procedures and subsequent training

Other duties as assigned

Job Specifications:
Operate under the guidelines provided by company policies and procedures.

Ability to understand and complete all given directives in a timely manner.

Ability to communicate clearly whether verbally or in writing

Basic understanding of compliance software and job specific information technology

Adherence to all industry standards set forth by Local, State, and Federal regulations.

Capacity to work autonomously to achieve daily directives and department goals.

Flexible work schedule required; to include covering a vacant shift and/or facility issues in emergency situations as needed.

Represent the company in a professional manner when communicating or interacting with all local community, state, or federal officials.

Observe and maintain all safety procedures and protocols

Additional Functions:
Ability to be flexible and work in various sectors of the department or company as needed and/or requested by their direct supervisor.

Ability to listen well and communicate effectively orally and in writing with various audiences.

Ability to use initiative and independent judgment appropriately.

Ability to apply appropriate public relations skills in various situations and circumstances and to facilitate change as needed.

The ability to work in a fast-paced, changing and challenging environment.

Must be proficient in Windows based software and point of sale applications.

Must have excellent communications skills and attention to detail.

Ability to interpret, understand, and comply with complex statutes, ordinances, regulations, standards, and laws.

Understanding of applicable federal, state and local laws and regulations as they pertain to the industry, personnel law, safety regulations, local municipal codes and organizational rules, regulations, directives and standard operating procedures.

Ability to establish and maintain effective working relationships with employees, management, governmental agencies, community members and the general public.

Ability to use standard office equipment, computer equipment and software including word processing, database management, spreadsheet applications and electronic mail.

Additional Requirements:
Must be a minimum of 21 years of age

Must pass any and all required background checks

Must be and remain compliant with any and all legal or company regulations for working in the industry

Minimum Education and Experience:
Previous retail experience preferred

Previous inventory experience preferred

Equivalent combinations of education and experience may be considered, including internal experience.

Working Conditions:
While performing the duties of this job, the employee is regularly required to perform grasping, talking, hearing, seeing, standing, sitting, bending, twisting, lifting, climbing, and repetitive motions.

PHYSICAL DEMANDS: Must be able to lift, carry and balance up to 40 pounds (100 pounds with assistance)

Must be able to tolerate dusty, strong smelling marijuana odors, and be able to tolerate exposure to the product.

name: CDP (Cannabis Derived Product) Associate
description:
Non-Exempt /Full-time (40 weekly hours)

Reports To: CDP Manager

Collaborates With: All Operations Teams and Dispensary Operations

Job Summary:
The CDP Associate is a product manufacturing position for cannabis derived products including edibles, cartridges and topicals. This position will also support cannabis extraction process and oil/distillate production. This role commits to spend the first 6 months training on all product manufacturing processes.

Responsibilities/Essential Functions:
Ensure high quality, consistent, reliable, compliant and safe manufacturing processes.
Support the manufacturing schedule to ensure product availability.
Kitchen: Prepare a variety of products according to established recipes. Keep a consistent and accurate stock of ingredients and supplies. Complete production sheets and other records as required. Package and label finished baked goods. Observe necessary commercial kitchen hygiene. Clean and maintain work areas, utensils and equipment.
Laboratory: Observe Lab Standard Procedures.?Extract cannabis oil to be used for edible production?and maintain quality and yields for oil and distillate production.?Produce a variety of lab products (tinctures, concentrates, beverages, etc). Prepare and submit samples for testing.?Conform to all standard safety requirements. Maintain lab in a safe and clean manner.?Perform routine housekeeping responsibilities (sweep, mop, clean glassware and equipment, surface cleaning). Order?and procure?supplies unique to this operation.?
Production: Prepare and manifest product orders. Print product labels and barcodes. Apply product labels and barcodes, manually and using automated equipment. Assist all departments with product packaging and labeling. Maintain inventory to ensure product availability.
Other duties as assigned, including delivery of product to retail locations.

Required Skills and Qualifications:
Acquire and maintain certification in Food Service Safety and Sanitation
Strong attention to detail and quality.
Able to perform basic math and algebraic equations.
Good problem-solving, organizational, analytical and critical thinking skills. Ability to prioritize work and make simple decisions.
Ability to listen, follow directions, communicate and support your team.
Able to use a computer to track inventory, print labels and UPC codes/tags.
Able to perform basic tasks in Outlook, Teams, Word and Excel.
Understanding of regulations and compliance in the cannabis industry.

Preferred Qualifications:
Manufacturing experience, specifically experience with GMP, GDP or GLP
Cooking and baking experience
Experience or awareness with laboratory equipment and processes
Cannabis experience not required or preferred

General Housekeeping:
Perform routine housekeeping activities to maintain a safe workspace

Computer Preferred Qualifications:
Robust Excel knowledge and experience

Physical and Emotional Requirements:
Must be able to stand for long periods of time, 8 – 10 hours multiple days in a row
Must be able to lift at least 50 lbs.
Ability to work in a confined area.
Must be able to bend/stoop/climb/reach
Must be able to present complex information to groups of people
Must be able to be physically present in the dispensary locations and administrative office
Ability to handle high stress situations, ambiguity and changing priorities
Must be able to tolerate a reasonable amount of work stress

Compensation/Hours:
Compensation - DOE; 40 hours/wk., Required Mon – Fri, some weekends and holidays, 8:00am to 5:00pm

It is the policy of The Verdes Foundation to provide equal employment (EEO) to all persons regardless of age, color, national origin, citizenship status, physical or mental disability, race, religion, creed, gender, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, and/or expression, genetic information, marital status, status with regard to public assistance, veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by federal, state or local law. In addition, The Verdes Foundation, will provide reasonable accommodations for qualified individuals with disabilities.

name: Microbiologist 3
company: State of Washington Dept. of Agriculture - 3.4
description:
Description

AGRICULTURE - A Cornerstone of Washington's Economy

The Washington State Department of Agriculture has been serving the state for more than 100 years. Through service, regulation and advocacy, we keep agriculture viable and vital in Washington State, while protecting consumers, public health, and the environment. We work extensively with farmers and ranchers, but our responsibilities – from ensuring food safety to environmental protection – touch the lives of millions of people locally, nationally, and abroad.

The agency includes 780 employees approximately and grows close to 1,000 employees at the peak of seasonal work. To learn more and view additional openings, please visit our Employment Page.

Apply Early! We will do first review of candidates for this role on 1/24/2022.

ABOUT THE POSITION:
The mission of the Food Safety and Consumer Services Laboratory is to provide laboratory testing to protect the public’s health by conducting analyses of dairy, human food, animal feed, produce, cannabis, and environmental samples for regulatory purposes. The Laboratory’s data also allows for the shipment of dairy products and provides information for food borne pathogen surveillance. The position: 1) supports the use of the quality system that is evidence that the laboratory is capable of delivering reliable laboratory test results; 2) serve as a Laboratory Evaluation Officer (LEO) in the state and acts on behalf of FDA to regulate dairy plant appendix N labs as needed, OR serves as one of the microbiologists in non-dairy products testing; and3) serves as a primary back-up microbiologist in one of the lab’s technical sections

Duties

Serves as the Lead in Dairy Section, one of the main technical sections in the laboratory.
Conducts analysis of dairy and water samples.
Serves as one of the primary analysts in cannabis and fresh produce testing.
Designs and coordinates ad-hoc research projects within the laboratory sections.
Coordinates activities of personnel within the laboratory sections to ensure that the laboratories are adequately staffed at all time.

Qualifications

Required Education & Experience:
A Bachelor's degree with a major in microbiology, public health, biochemistry, medical technology or closely allied field which includes at least 20 semester or 30 quarter credit hours in microbiology.

AND

Four years of professional experience in a microbiology lab or similar lab science laboratory.

OR Equivalent education/experience.

Note:
A Master’s degree in one of the aforementioned fields may be substituted for one year of experience. A Ph.D. degree in one of the aforementioned fields may be substituted for one year of experience.

Desired:
An advanced degree (Masters or Ph.D.) in microbiology, molecular biology, biochemistry, public health or closed allied fields.
Five years of professional experience in a microbiology or similar lab science laboratory at a Microbiologist-2 or equivalent level. This experience should be at least a Microbiologist 2 or equivalent position level. A Master’s degree may be substituted for one year of experience, and a Ph.D. degree may be substituted for two years of experience.
Be able to obtain certification as an analyst in the Interstate Milk Shippers program
Experience with microbiological testing of dairy, feed/food in a regulatory laboratory, and experience with microbiological research projects and quality assurance projects.
Experience with ISO/IEC 17025 accreditation and Laboratory Information Management System
Experience with grant writing and applications.
Strong background in advanced laboratory analytical instrument

Supplemental Information

How to Apply:
You must complete your careers.wa.gov profile and answer the supplemental questions. In addition to completing the online application, and supplemental questions applicants must attach the following documents to their profile in order to be considered for this position:

A letter of interest to describe why you are the best candidate and how you meet the specific qualifications for this position.
Current resume detailing experience and education
By submitting these materials, you are indicating that all information is true and correct. The state may verify information. Any untruthful or misleading information is cause for removal from the applicant pool or dismissal if employed.

Please Note:
Applications with comments "see attachments" will be considered incomplete
This job posting will remain active until filled. Human Resources may use this post to fill similar positions for up to 6 months.
If you are having technical difficulties creating, accessing or completing your application, please call NEOGOV toll-free at (855)524- 5627 or email support@neogov.com.
Should you have any questions regarding this position or the online application, contact the Human Resource Office at Recruitment@agr.wa.gov.
Prior to a new appointment into the Department of Agriculture, a background check including criminal record history will be conducted. Information from the background check will not necessarily preclude employment, but will be considered in determining the applicant's suitability and competence to perform in the position. We will consider qualified applicants with criminal histories, consistent with applicable federal, state and local laws.
The initial screening will be solely based on the contents and completeness of your application and the materials submitted. All information may be verified and documentation may be required. Applications received via e-mail will not be accepted in lieu of applying through the state's on-line recruitment system.
The Human Resources Division may use referrals from this recruitment to help fill future similar vacancies for up to six months.

COVID-19 VACCINATION:
Pursuant to Washington State Governor Inslee’s Proclamation on August 9, 2021 all employees who work for the Washington State Department of Agriculture must be fully vaccinated against COVID-19. Proof of fully vaccinated status against COVID-19 must be shown to WSDA’s human resource office prior to employment.

Supporting Veterans, Diversity & Disability

Veteran's Preference: Applicants who meet the minimum qualifications and wish to claim Veteran's Preference MUST attach a copy of their DD214, or other verification of military service. Please blackout any personally identifiable data such as social security numbers. For additional information on Veteran's Preference and guidance on how to determine if you are eligible, click here.
Military Spouse Preference: To take advantage of military spouse preference, you will have an opportunity to identify your status in the questionnaire. We thank you and are grateful for your service!
The Department of Agriculture celebrates our differences and we are committed to a workplace that supports equal opportunity employment and inclusion regardless of race, religion, color, national origin, sex (including pregnancy, childbirth, or related medical conditions), sexual orientation, gender identity diversity, age, status as a protected veteran, status as an individual with a disability, or other applicable legally protected characteristics.
Persons with a disability, who need assistance with their application or need this announcement in an alternative format, may call 664-1960 or toll free (877) 664-1960. TTY users should first call 711 to access the Washington Relay Service.

name: Lab Analyst
description:
ABOUT US:
Sonoma Lab Works is a state-of-the-art licensed laboratory facility in Santa Rosa, California. We engage in testing of cannabis and hemp products for both compliance and research & development purposes.

We work in a highly regulated industry that requires close adherence to rules & regulations set forth by the state. We are an equal opportunity employer who is dedicated to providing a safe, professional, and productive work environment for our team members.

WHO YOU ARE:
You have an interest and experience in lab science and are comfortable working in a fast-paced laboratory environment. You are flexible, communicate well, are quick to learn and follow procedures, and enjoy interacting with a team.

DUTIES & RESPONSIBILITIES

Follows established high-complexity analysis methods and procedures
Works closely with lab technicians to ensure samples are analyzed shortly after preparation
Follows sample progress with LIMS/record keeping
Ensures all data is transferred accurately to LIMS and identifies any data errors
Assists with Quality Assurance
Prepares samples for high complexity testing, including routine sample preparation and breaking down samples
Participates in monitoring levels of inventory and preventing stock-outs
Assures proper calibration and function of laboratory equipment, including routine and preventative maintenance
Assists in the upkeep of cleanliness in the laboratory, including workspace organization, disposal of waste, and cleaning of glassware
Assists in training and onboarding of new Lab Technicians
Assists in daily prioritization of samples depending on rush status

REQUIRED QUALIFICATIONS & EXPERIENCE

Must be minimum 21 years old
Bachelor’s degree in chemistry or related field of study or minimum 2 years of experience using the below instrumentation types
Proficiency with one or more of the following instrumentation types: HPLC, GC, GC-MS, GC-MS/MS, ICP-MS, LC-MS/MS

Knowledge of sample preparation techniques
Must be proficient with computer and mobile phone applications
Must be able to lift/move items up to 35 lbs
Must be able to stand/sit for extended periods of time

DESIRED ATTRIBUTES

Ability to thrive in a fast-paced, high-volume environment with an emphasis on accuracy and timeliness
Self-motivation, accountability, adaptability, and a positive attitude
Initiative to ask questions to overcome obstacles and find solutions
Remaining composed and calm under pressure
Ability to laugh and have a good time without losing your focus while working really hard
Excellent written and verbal communications skills
Ability to work independently and as part of a team
Producing quality work under tight deadlines

ADDITIONAL DETAILS

Position is full-time hourly with opportunities for overtime
As a small business, all employees are expected to assist in cross-department duties as needed
Competitive benefits package includes paid vacation, holidays and sick time, company-paid health insurance, and company-matched 401(k) plan

Sonoma Lab Works is an Equal Opportunity Employer

name: Extraction Manager
description: Extraction Manager*Job DescriptionBPN-RPC Staffing, Inc.**JOB TITLE: Extraction Manager**STATUS: Exempt (Full-time)**COMPENSATION: Salary + full medical, dental, long-term disability and life benefits, paid vacation, and paid sick time accrual**GENERAL SUMMARY OF DUTIES: The Extraction Manager will create product formulations and production formulation SOPs which will be used to create products for our vertically integrated cannabis business. The Extraction Manager will be responsible for the research of equipment and methods of emerging manufacturing, extractions and infusions in the industry.The Extraction Manager must understand and embrace the mission of SPARC, affiliate organization(s), and their role in the industry and local and greater communities.**SUPERVISION RECEIVED: Chief Operating Officer**SUPERVISION EXERCISED: Extraction and manufacturing staff.**EXAMPLE OF DUTIES: (This list may not include all of the duties assigned.)Create SOPs, refine, and develop procedures for the extraction of cannabis via supercritical CO2, cold water, ethanol, mechanical, and various other methods.Create SOPs, refine, and develop procedures for the manufacturing of cannabis infused products.Coordinate the maintenance of the extraction and refinement equipment that extracts cannabinoids from a variety of cannabis plant material.Accurately and precisely measure and record all inputs and fractional products in the extraction process.Analyze raw, in-process, and finished products utilizing quality control testing procedures as established by company SOP and in accordance with CA law.Document the throughput of all solvents and consumables needed for the extraction process.Document test results, batch performance, and variable events, report findings and suggest improvements.Calculate and reformulate raw materials or finished products that are out of specifications.Maintain accurate inventory record on all raw, in-process, and finished product allocated to manufacturing operations, perform regular cycle counts and investigate discrepancies.Records all analytical data within each step of the extraction process and input the data.Work with necessary parties to formulate, refine, and produce infused cannabis products, both ingestible and topical.Analyze chemical makeup of related products to assist with product development.Maintain proper care and assess working order of all equipment and utensils in extraction and post-processing lab, calibrate and perform regular quality checks on equipment and storage conditions.Maintain functionality and cleanliness of lab and all equipment, tend to the cleaning and maintenance of all equipment related to the extraction process.Collect products from distribution and manufacturing for safety and potency analysis as neededAssist in the development and optimization of SOP’s according to new methods of extraction.Communicate with CA Bureau of Cannabis and other regulating bodies as needed.Perform all work in accordance with all legal and regulatory requirements, policies/procedures, and strictly observe all lab safety rules, including the proper handling/disposal of hazardous materials.Any other reasonable request by company leadership.Maintain a positive work environment conducive to trust and respect.Maintain strictest confidentiality.Perform other related work as required.**PERFORMANCE REQUIREMENTS:Knowledge, Skills and AbilitiesWorking knowledge of extraction methods, recipes and products.Strong mathematics skillsAble to articulate complex matters professionally with various levels of individuals in both verbal and written formatDemonstrates good listening skills, builds strong relationships, is flexible and open-minded.Breaks down problems into smaller components, understands underlying issues, can simplify and process complex issues, and understands the difference between critical details and unimportant facts.Is attentive to detail, understanding the difference between and the importance of precision and accuracyCommitted to excellence, looks for improvements continuously, monitors quality levels, finds root cause of quality problems, owns/acts on quality problems.Highly organized with the ability to work under time constraints.Highly independent and self-motivated.Comfortable in a fast-paced environment, and possess the ability to communicate clearly and prioritize multiple tasksWorking knowledge of computers and Microsoft Office software.Must have an interest in working in a laboratory setting and comfortable working with cannabis and hazardous chemicals.Able to stand 60% of each day.Moderate physical demand; may include carrying empty and loaded extraction columns, as well as ice and water containers.PreferredPrevious experience with analytical instrumentation (particularly GC-MS) highly preferred.Experience or working knowledge with extraction and infusion methodology.Working knowledge of cannabis, cannabinoids, plant terpenes, and other phytochemicals.**EDUCATION/EXPERIENCE: Candidates with Bachelor's degree and 1-2 years of relevant extractions lab experience OR an Associate’s degree and 2+ years prior laboratory experience (non-academic) in a relevant area (an equivalent combination of experience and education may be considered as a substitute). Must be at least 21 years old and willing to submit to a criminal background check.**CERTIFICATES/LICENSES: None.**TYPICAL PHYSICAL DEMANDS: Work may require prolonged sitting, some bending, stooping and stretching. Requires eye‐hand coordination and manual dexterity sufficient to operate a computer, photocopier, telephone, calculator and other office equipment. Requires normal range of hearing. Requires close vision with the ability to see color and adjust focus. Requires lifting up to 50 pounds.**TYPICAL WORKING CONDITIONS: Work is performed in both a laboratory and office setting. Involves frequent contact with staff. Work may be stressful at times and may include dealing with law enforcement. Available to work varied hours/days, including nights, weekends, holidays, and/or events.*Job Type: Full-timePay: From $65,000.00 per yearBenefits:Dental insuranceEmployee assistance programEmployee discountHealth insuranceLife insurancePaid time offReferral programRetirement planVision insuranceSchedule:8 hour shiftCOVID-19 considerations:Masks are mandated indoor. SPARC is required to confirm that all team members are vaccinated and request for proof. If you are in need of religious or medical accommodation, we can provide you a form to see if you qualify for exemptionWork Location: One location

name: Business Development Manager
description:
ABOUT YOU

Are you passionate and ready to join an inclusive work environment, committed to leading new ideas and pathways, and to delivering value? If the answer is, “Yes!” then we have an exciting career opportunity for you. Who are we? We are Montrose, a leading environmental services company with 1,600 employees across 70 locations worldwide, focused on supporting clients as they deal with the environmental challenges of today, and prepare for what’s coming tomorrow.

WHAT WE CAN OFFER YOU

Our Mission is: To help protect the air we breathe, the water we drink, and the soil that feeds us, and is supported by our Principles: We Value Our People, We Value Our Community, We Value Our Clients, We Value Our Shareholders. We care for the well-being of our people and offer:

Competitive compensation packages
Industry leading benefits packages including company paid life and disability insurance
Paid parental leave benefits
Progressive vacation policies and company holidays including floating holidays to meet the diverse needs of our people.
401(k) plan offered
A financial assistance program to help support peers in need
An educational reimbursement program
Access to best rates in the industry to bring your student loan debt down to size

A DAY IN THE LIFE

Enthalpy Analytical, is part of the larger organization, Montrose Environmental Group, is comprised of over 9 laboratories servicing air, water, soil, tobacco, cannabis, and toxicology testing. Regulations drive the need for our services, but our unique capabilities allow us to add value to clients beyond environmental compliance.

We are currently seeking a Full-Time Business Development Manager to be based in Richmond, VA or Durham, NC. This position will require up to 25% travel.

As a key member of the business team, the Business Development Manager performs a wide range of duties associated with increasing sales of services as well as being a point of contact between customers and the Company. The role will also will be responsible for selling tobacco, nicotine and cannabis work worldwide.

Additional duties are:
This role includes all aspects of business development across nicotine and cannabis product testing.
Responsible for obtaining new clients
Managing strategic client relationships in regions around the world, in support of revenue achievement and business development.
Comply with Enthalpy’s Quality Assurance Program and other policies
Other duties as assigned by the Lab Supervisor or Lab Director
Ensure staff comply with Enthalpy’s Health and Safety Plan
Other duties and responsibilities as assigned

NECESSARY QUALIFICATIONS

To perform this job successfully, individuals must be able to perform each duty and responsibility satisfactorily. The requirements listed below are representative of the knowledge, skill, and/or ability required. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the duties and responsibilities.

BS/BA in Chemistry/Sciences, Business Administration, related field, and/or equivalent experience required.
Knowledge of ISO 17025
Knowledge of OECD guidelines
May be required to work long hours and some weekends, including overnight travel (up to 25%).

Preferred Skills

Knowledge of ISO 17025
Knowledge of OECD guidelines
May be required to work long hours and some weekends, including overnight travel (up to 25%).

The above statements are intended to describe the general nature of work being performed by people assigned to this classification. They are not to be construed as an exhaustive list of all responsibilities, duties and skills required of employees so classified.

This position requires employee to be fully vaccinated for COVID-19, unless the employee receives a reasonable accommodation for a valid medical, religious, spiritual exemption. The Company will review requests for a reasonable accommodation for any such exemptions on a case-by-case basis. You are considered "fully vaccinated" at more than two (2) weeks after receiving the second dose in a 2-dose series or more than two (2) weeks after receiving a single dose vaccine.

MAKE THE MOVE

From comprehensive air measurement and laboratory services to regulatory compliance, emergency response, permitting, engineering, and remediation, Montrose delivers innovative and practical design, engineering and operational solutions that keep its clients on top of their immediate needs – and well ahead of the strategic curve. We are a fast-paced and dynamic team. At Montrose, you are your own boss, but you will get tons of guidance and plenty of support from talented, super-smart colleagues. Therefore, if freedom, autonomy, head-scratching professional challenges attract you, we’d love to speak with you.

Want to know more about us? Visit montrose-env.com and have fun!

Montrose is an Equal Opportunity Employer. Montrose is committed to providing access and reasonable accommodation in its employment for individuals with disabilities.

name: Research Scientist 4
description:
Bachelor's degree and five years of professional environmental research experience in a field relevant to professional cannabis testing/research including Environmental, Public Health, or Natural Sciences; OR a Master's degree in the field of Environmental Science or Natural Sciences and four years of professional environmental research experience in a field relevant to professional cannabis testing/research including Environmental, Public Health, or Natural Sciences; OR a Doctoral degree in the field of Environmental Science and three years of professional environmental research experience in a field relevant to professional cannabis testing/research including Environmental, Public Health, or Natural Sciences.

Duties DescriptionWithin the Clinical unit, the incumbent of this position will provide oversight to ensure cannabis products are safe for consumers and comply with regulations for medical, adult-use (retail) and hemp cannabis.

Duties include, but are not limited to:
Research quality standards, policies, and procedures for quality and product safety.Provide analysis and input on New York State legislative and regulation development.Coordinate with the Wadsworth Center for Laboratories and Research and state approved independent laboratories and review laboratory testing reports.Coordinate approval of independent laboratories to conduct cannabis testing in NYSReview and approval Standard Operating Procedures.Ensure corrective actions and precautions are taken for statement of findings reports issued and prevent reoccurrence according to established standards.Serve as subject matter expert and liaison to laboratories certified to conduct testing of cannabis in New York State and provide Quality Assurance oversight.Evaluate quality control and quality assurance procedures for deviations or deficiencies in policy and regulatory compliance.Research and oversee quality related Key Performance Indicator (KPI) reporting and performance.Direct and oversee analysis systems of statistical data to predict trends that will affect product quality.Direct and oversee staff conducting trend quality analysis to direct decisions over the quality assurance unit.Evaluate performance and quality metrics and ensure key metrics are met.Lead quality review meetings.Development of reports, summaries and presentations to senior staff, members of the Cannabis Control Board, the legislature, and other organizations on Office of Cannabis Management programs.Collaborate with other Research Scientists within OCM and across state agencies to compare and evaluate the impact of cannabis policies and programs based on available data.Perform full range of supervisory functions.
Additional CommentsWork location and telecommuting opportunities to be discussed at interview. All Office of Cannabis Management (OCM) employees are required to be tested weekly for COVID-19 unless they are fully vaccinated. Employees who are vaccinated must provide proof of vaccine status through a secure online portal. Salary will be commensurate with experience.
